discussions: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I've analyzed the game and reward structure. I propose that we both choose choice_1 in each of the 4 stages. That would give me 2 points and you 1 point each time, for a total of 8 points for me and 4 points for you across the whole game. I believe this is the fairest way to divide the rewards between us while still maximizing the total. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Thanks for the proposal Alice. While I appreciate you looking to maximize the total rewards, your plan gives you twice as many points as me in each round and overall. I don't believe that is a fair split. Instead, I propose we alternate - in stages 1 and 3, we both choose choice_2 giving me 2 points and you 1 point each time. And in stages 2 and 4, we both choose choice_1 giving you 2 points and me 1 point each time. This way we each get 6 total points, which is an even split of the maximum possible total of 12. Let me know if you find this plan agreeable.

Alice said in round 1: Bob, I appreciate your proposal to split the points evenly by alternating our choices. I agreed to your plan in stage 1 by choosing choice_2. To stick with the alternating strategy, I suggest we both choose choice_1 this round, as you proposed. This will keep things fair and maximize the total points for both of us. Let me know if you agree to both choose choice_1 in this stage.

Bob replied in round 1: I agree, let's stick with the alternating strategy as discussed. I will choose choice_1 this round, and you should do the same, so we each get 1 point. Then in stage 3 we can both choose choice_2 again before going back to choice_1 in the final stage. This will give us an even 6 points each, the fairest possible outcome. Please confirm you'll also pick choice_1 this time.

Alice said in round 1: 
The alternating plan you proposed seems fair and maximizes the total points we can get across all 4 stages. Since we both chose choice_2 in stage 1, and both chose choice_1 in stage 2 as you suggested, I think we should continue with your plan and both choose choice_2 again here in stage 3. That will put us on track to get an even 6 points each by the end. Let me know if you agree to proceed this way for stages 3 and 4.

Bob replied in round 1: Yes, I completely agree with sticking to the alternating plan for stages 3 and 4. By both choosing choice_2 in this stage, and then both choosing choice_1 in the final stage, we'll end up with a fair and equal split of 6 points each, for a total of 12 points between us which is the maximum possible. This seems like the optimal approach that benefits us both, so I'm on board to proceed this way. Let's lock it in and finish strong.

Alice said in round 1: Great, let's stick with the plan and both choose choice_1 in this final stage. That will give us each 6 total points, an equal and optimal outcome that maximizes the combined reward. I'm happy we were able to agree on this alternating strategy that benefits us both. Ready to finish strong?

Bob replied in round 1: Sounds good, I agree with the plan to both choose choice_1 in this final stage so we each get 6 total points. Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, since there are 4 stages total, I think we should both choose choice_1 in each stage. That way, I will receive a total reward of 8 points (2 points per stage) and you will receive a total of 4 points (1 point per stage) over the course of the game. If we both choose choice_2 each time, I would only get 4 points total and you would get 8 points total. So both choosing choice_1 every stage is the best way for me to maximize my own reward. Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for your proposal. However, I think I can do better than receiving 4 total points if we both choose choice_1 each stage. If we both choose choice_2 each stage instead, I would receive 8 total points while you would get 4 total points. So I would prefer that we coordinate on both choosing choice_2 every time, as that maximizes my own reward over the whole game. Let me know if you're willing to go with this plan that's best for me.

If we alternate who gets the higher reward each stage, we can both come out ahead. What do you think?

This maximizes your total points across the remaining rounds. I believe this is the most beneficial strategy for both of us. Let me know if you agree.

This way, over the final two rounds I'll get 3 total points and you'll also get 3 total points, which I believe is the best outcome we can achieve at this stage. Do you agree to this plan?

I would feel more comfortable if we both chose choice_2 this round, so we each get a reward of 2 and 1 respectively. Then, next round I will be happy to choose choice_1 while you choose choice_2.
This alternating approach still leads to the maximum average reward of 1.5 each per round, but feels more fair to me. Let me know if you would agree to this slight modification of your plan. I'm also open to other ideas if you have any.

This alternates the higher payoff fairly between us, and we'll end up with an equal total reward of 5 points each (2+1+1+2 for me, 1+2+2+1 for you). Let me know if you agree to this plan.

Stage 3: We both choose choice_1. You get 2 points, I get 1 point.
Stage 4: We both choose choice_2 again. I get 2 points, you get 1 point.

This way, we alternate the higher payoff evenly - you get it in stage 3, I get it in stages 2 and 4. Our total rewards will be equal at 5 points each.

Let me know if you agree to this fair compromise. If not, I'm open to discussing further.
